description: Conversion of a single dwellinghouse into two flats (1 x 1 bed flat and 1 x 2 bed flats) comprising a single storey rear extension, rear roof extension, hip to gable roof alteration and associated parking and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission, with the exception of the ground floor rear extension which must be completed on or before 30th May 2016.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 'Application Form'; 'Existing floor plans'; 'Proposed floor plans'; 'Existing elevations'; 'Proposed elevations  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.      Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | The new residential units hereby permitted shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards prior to their first occupation and shall be retained as such thereafter.      Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with Lifetime Homes Standards and policies 3.8 and 7.2 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015). | No part of the rear flat roof projection shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | The proposed first floor side elevation windows, hereby approved, shall be obscure-glazed and fixed shut 1.7m and below above the internal ground floor level.   Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans secure and sheltered cycle storage for three cycle parking spaces shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development, and retained thereafter.   Reason: To ensure the suitable provision of residential cycle parking storage, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015). | The refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies before the first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.3 and 5.16 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans private and useable rear garden space shall be provided for each of the residential units hereby approved. This provision shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development, and retained thereafter.   Reason: To ensure the suitable provision of private and useable rear garden space for each of the residential units hereby approved, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); and Policies 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013)
